hidden_cost_radar.flag: Zero-gravity performance capture and wire removal
hidden_cost_radar.why_it_matters: Every scene set in space will require either wire rigs with extensive paint-out or full digital double work. This is a per-shot cost that scales with the entire film's runtime.
mitigation_ideas: Evaluate LED volume / virtual production stages early to reduce compositing passes
Consider robotic camera rigs (e.g., Bot & Dolly style) to move the camera around a stationary actor, reducing wire work
Budget for a dedicated wire-removal team embedded in the post pipeline from day one

hidden_cost_radar.flag: Photoreal CG Earth and orbital environments
hidden_cost_radar.why_it_matters: Earth as a backdrop must hold up in every frame at feature-film resolution. Any shortfall in fidelity will break immersion instantly given audience familiarity with the real thing.
mitigation_ideas: License high-resolution satellite imagery and NASA assets early
Develop a modular Earth asset pipeline that supports day/night terminator, weather systems, and atmospheric scattering
Use procedural cloud and atmosphere systems to avoid repetitive looks across scenes

hidden_cost_radar.why_it_matters: Space debris fields involve massive particle counts, rigid-body dynamics, and secondary fragmentation that are computationally expensive and art-direction intensive.
mitigation_ideas: Pre-visualize debris sequences thoroughly to lock editorial before committing to final simulations
Layer hero debris (hand-animated or art-directed) over procedural background fields to control costs
Establish render-farm capacity and turnaround benchmarks early in pre-production

hidden_cost_radar.flag: Interactive and dynamic lighting on actors
hidden_cost_radar.why_it_matters: Actors in space suits must be lit by rotating Earth-glow, direct sunlight, and instrument panels. Mismatched lighting between plate and CG environment is the most common tell in space films.
mitigation_ideas: Use programmable LED light rigs synced to previs environment rotation
Shoot HDRI references for every setup to feed into compositing
Consider in-camera LED volume for medium shots to capture real interactive light

hidden_cost_radar.why_it_matters: Helmet visors produce reflections, refractions, fogging, and breath condensation that must all be tracked and composited per shot. This is a hidden per-shot multiplier across the entire film.
mitigation_ideas: Design helmets with removable visors for close-ups; add CG visors in post
Standardize a visor compositing template early to streamline the pipeline
Capture clean-plate and polarized reference for every helmet shot
